Package com.spiderweb

Class SpiderWeb<E>

java.lang.Object
com.spiderweb.SpiderWeb<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of elements stored in the SpiderWeb
public class SpiderWeb<E> extends Object
SpiderWeb is a custom data structure designed to organize elements in a hierarchical and indexed manner. It is implemented as a linked structure with nodes organized in levels and indices. The class provides methods for adding, querying, and removing elements based on their levels and indices within the SpiderWeb.

Usage Example: 

 SpiderWeb<Integer> spiderWeb = new SpiderWeb<>();
 spiderWeb.add(1);
 spiderWeb.add(2);
 spiderWeb.add(3);
 System.out.println(spiderWeb.toString());
Since:
November 21, 2023

    Constructs a SpiderWeb with a default maximum number of elements per level (6).

    • getMaximumIndexForLevel

      public int getMaximumIndexForLevel(int level) throws IllegalArgumentException, IllegalStateException
      Gets the maximum index for a specified level in the SpiderWeb.
      Parameters:
      level - The level for which to retrieve the maximum index.
      Returns:
      The maximum index for the specified level.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the specified level is negative or exceeds the maximum level in the SpiderWeb.
      IllegalStateException - If the SpiderWeb is empty, and the maximum index cannot be determined.

    • indexOf

      public HashMap<String,Integer> indexOf(E e)

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • lastIndexOf

      public HashMap<String,Integer> lastIndexOf(E e)
      Searches for the last occurrence of the specified element and returns its level and index in the SpiderWeb.
      Parameters:
      e - The element to search for in the SpiderWeb.
      Returns:
      A HashMap containing the level and index of the last occurrence of the specified element.

    • set

      public E set(int level, int index, E element)
      Sets the element at the specified level and index in the SpiderWeb, replacing any existing element. Returns the previous value at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      level - The level at which to set the element.
      index - The index within the specified level to set the element.
      element - The new element to be set at the specified level and index.
      Returns:
      The previous value at the specified level and index.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided level or index is invalid.
      IllegalStateException - If the operation fails to set the element, which should not occur under normal conditions.

    • removeLast

      public E removeLast()
      Removes and returns the last element from the SpiderWeb.
      Returns:
      The last element in the SpiderWeb.
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException - If the SpiderWeb is empty.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Removes all elements from the SpiderWeb. After calling this method, the SpiderWeb will have no elements.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the SpiderWeb, including its current level, index, size, and maximum elements per level.

      Returns:
